message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.SI, cs.DS 

This paper deals with the problem of cost-sensitive multiclass classification, which is a common problem in machine learning. The paper proposes a new framework called the "apportioned margin" approach, which is a modification of the large margin classifier. This approach can be applied to a variety of machine learning algorithms, including kernel methods and neural networks. Given the broad scope of the paper, it could potentially fit into several different arXiv CS sub-categories. However, based on the content of the paper, the most likely categories are cs.LG (Machine Learning), cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), cs.CV (Computer Vision), cs.SI (Social and Information Networks), and cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms).
